main_definition: Bytes is a unit of digital information that represents a sequence of binary digits (bits) commonly used to measure the size or capacity of data storage devices.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In computing, 'byte' refers to an amount of memory or computer storage equal to 8 bits.
meanings_and_examples.example: A typical image file can take up several kilobytes (KB) of space.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The term 'bytes' is also used in networking and telecommunications, where it represents a unit of data transmission rate or bandwidth.
meanings_and_examples.example: If your internet connection speed is advertised as 10 megabytes per second (MB/s), this means you can download up to 8 megabytes of data every second.

meanings_and_examples.definition: 'Bytes' are sometimes used colloquially to refer to a small quantity or amount of something, often with a negative connotation.
meanings_and_examples.example: He only has a few bytes left in his piggy bank for the new bike he wants.

meanings_and_examples.definition: 'Bytes' is also used informally as a slang term to refer to people, particularly when describing groups of friends or acquaintances.
meanings_and_examples.example: We went out with our own little bytes of the town last night.
